Vietnam - Korea University of Information and Communication Technology (VKU) is a member university of the University of Danang - a national key regional university, providing multi-field, multi-level and multi-disciplinary training programs in the Central - Central Highlands with more than 2,000 employees and over 50,000 undergraduate and graduate students.

VKU defines its mission and responsibility in training and supplying high-quality human resources, researching, transferring knowledge and technology with the vision of becoming a leading application-oriented university in Vietnam together with the aspiration to reach the international level in training and research; operates following  an advanced governance model of a modern and smart university.

The staff meet the quantity and quality to implement the training programs of the University. Currently, the number of officers and employees is 250 (expected to 400 people), of which there are 139 lecturers (including 02 Associate Professors and 42 PhDs; 100% of the lecturers have masters degrees, 19 PhD students) were trained from countries with advanced education in the world such as: USA, France, Japan, UK, Korea, New Zealand, Australia, etc.

Spacious facilities, including: 106 classrooms with an area of 11,314 m2 equipped with teaching aids; 53 labs on 9,120 m2 with 1,877 computers.
library with an area of 2,750 m2 can accommodate more than 1,500 students with more than 55,000 books;
Student Center building has an area of 19,340 m2
Dormitory with 6 buildings with 547 rooms of 40,203 m2 to accommodate nearly 5,000 students.
Website: vku.udn.vn, admissions website: tuyensinh.vku.udn.vn

High school examination score
School profile
Ability assessment of National University of Ho Chi Minh City
Private admission

Successful candidates with a matriculation score of 25.00 points or more, candidates who are admitted by the method of considering the results of the competency assessment exam of Vietnam National University Ho Chi Minh City with a passing score of 1,000 or more. up (scale of 1,200) will be considered for financial support equivalent to 50% of the tuition fee of the first 2 semesters of the course.

Candidates who pass 25 points or more and have a letter of recommendation from the principal of the high school students are studying (each Principal can only refer 01 student) will be considered for financial support equivalent to 100% of the tuition fees of 2 courses. first term of the course.
